title: Chicken Thigh & Ginger Ramen
keywords: Ramen, Chicken thigh, Ginger, Japanese, Noodle soup, Comfort food

method.step: Before you start cooking, take your chicken out of the fridge and open the packet and let it air
Trim, then spice your spring onion(s) finely, separating the whites and green parts
Peel (scrape of the skin with a teaspoon) and finely chop (or grate) your ginger
Chop your mangetout into bite size pieces
Heat a large pot with a drizzle of vegetable oil over a heigh heat
Once hot, add the chopped ginger, star anise and chilli flakes and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly, or until fragrant and sizzling
Once fragrant, add your died chicken thigh and sliced mushrooms and cook for 4-5 minutes or until lightly browned
Add your Chinese rice wine and rice vinegar to the pot and cook for 30 secs or until evaporated
Add your boiled water sprinkle in your chicken stock mix and whisk thoroughly to combine
Bring to the boil and once boiling reduce the heat to medium heigh
Add your wholewheat noodles to the pot and cook for 4-5 minutes or until neatly cooked but with a slight bite
(The noodles will continue cooking to aim for a ‘al dente’ at this point)
Add your soy sauce and sliced onion whites
Add your chopped mangetout and cook for a final 2 minutes or until the noodles are tender and the chicken is cooked though.  This is your warming chicken & ginger ramen
Serve the warming chicken & ginger ramen in bowls
Garnish with the sliced onion greens and discard the star anise
